answers.answer: Hi there,Thanks for your question. Well as a matter of fact both these operations are not major ones and can be done within a matter of 2-3 hours. However, consideration also has to be given for anesthesia related complications. If you have any pre-existing hypertension or diabetes or any respiratory illness the morbidity associated with long duration of anesthesia also goes up.I advise you consult your urologist in this regard and suggest that you would like to complete both these procedures at one go.If you have any further queries do get in touch with me.Regards,Dr Sylvester, MD

question: I am a male aged 62 years. I have an enlarged prostrate ( grade 2 ) and left sided hydrocele. Can these two ailments  be cured by operation one after another or after a time gap ---- say one month apart.  Kindly advise.
title: enlarged prostrate and left hydrocele
